The restart of the plant which last produced yellowcake in 2008 is the first step in enCore's South Texas in-situ leach uranium production pipeline strategy. Fri, 01 Dec 2023 13:42:50 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Japan-and-EU-mark-first-plasma-from-JT-60SA-fusion?feed=feed a018c095-c0bb-4067-b318-f24a4ec6a93b Nuclear energy no longer a taboo, WNE hearsMuch progress has been made over recent years in the representation of nuclear in national, regional and international debates on energy and the climate, speakers agreed at the opening session of the 本周在巴黎举行的世界核展览。; Fri, 01 Dec 2023 16:48:47 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Nuclear-energy-no-longer-a-taboo,-WNE-hears?feed=feed c2270561-e960-4875-b761-bb2089af6ad7 SMR fuel supply chain grows as agreements signedOntario Power Generation has selected suppliers Cameco, Urenco USA, Orano and Global Nuclear Fuel-Americas for the first fuel contracts for its planned small modular reactor units at the Darlington New Nuclear Project, while TerraPower and uranium producer Uranium Energy Corp are to work together on the fuel supply chain ahead of the construction of the first-of-a-kind Natrium plant. Thu, 30 Nov 2023 15:12:15 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/SMR-fuel-supply-chain-grows-as-agreements-signed?feed=feed 10516612-9df8-4193-92b4-cd9bc9b4b148 Swedish nuclear bill passed by parliamentSweden's parliament has approved a bill that will clear the way for new nuclear power in the country by removing the current limit on the number of nuclear reactors in operation, as well as allowing reactors to be built on new sites. The amendment will enter into force on 1 January. Thu, 30 Nov 2023 15:37:54 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Swedish-nuclear-bill-passed-by-parliament?feed=feed 736f45f8-696a-4a5d-8c1a-59b8bd913513 Nuclear to 'shine' at COP28, says Bilbao y LeónThe nuclear energy industry will be highly visible at the 第 28 届缔约方大会将于未来几周在迪拜举行，世界核协会总干事萨马·毕尔巴鄂·莱昂 (Sama Bilbao y León) 在2023 年巴黎世界核展上向代表们表示。; Wed, 29 Nov 2023 09:11:15 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Nuclear-to-shine-at-COP28,-says-Bilbao-y-Leon?feed=feed e7d6761f-231b-45c0-85c8-ae61f415d678 Urenco agrees supply deal with Energoatom to 2035The contract will see Urenco continuing to supply Ukraine's Energoatom with enriched uranium until 2035, with an option to extend the contract to 2043.  Thu, 30 Nov 2023 15:12:49 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Urenco-agrees-supply-deal-with-Energoatom-to-2035?feed=feed 0beb9488-56f4-42fa-a9e1-daaef6d4f3eb Nuclearelectrica and Framatome in lutetium-177 agreementRomania's Nuclearelectrica and France's Framatome have signed a cooperation agreement on exploring the production of the medical isotope lutetium-177 at the Cernavoda nuclear power plant.
